english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: She used to say when she performed tashahhud: 'All greetings, good deeds, and prayers are for Allah. I bear witness that there is no god but Allah alone with no partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is the servant of Allah and His Messenger. Peace be upon you, O Prophet, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah. Peace be upon you all.'

english_translation: Chapter: What the person who raises his head before the Imam should do
Topics: Chapter heading on prayer etiquette

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The one who raises his head and lowers it before the Imam, his forelock is in the hand of Satan. Malik said regarding one who forgets and raises his head before the Imam in ruku or sujud: The Sunnah regarding this is that he should return to ruku or sujud and not wait for the Imam. This is an error of the one who does it because the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'The Imam is appointed so that he is followed, so do not differ from him.' And Abu Hurayrah said: The one who raises his head and lowers it before the Imam, his forelock is in the hand of Satan.

Topics: Chapter heading on prayer error and correction

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ concluded the prayer from two rak'ahs. A man called Dhu al-Yadayn said to him: 'Has the prayer been shortened, O Messenger of Allah, or have you forgotten?' The Prophet ﷺ asked: 'Is Dhu al-Yadayn speaking the truth?' The people said: 'Yes.' The Prophet ﷺ stood and prayed two more rak'ahs, then he saluted. Then he said the Takbir and performed sujud like his usual sujud or even longer, then he raised and said the Takbir and performed another sujud like his usual sujud or even longer, then he raised.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ prayed the 'Asr prayer and concluded with salutation after two rak'ahs. Dhu al-Yadayn stood and said: 'Has the prayer been shortened, O Messenger of Allah, or have you forgotten?' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ responded: 'None of that occurred.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ stood and completed the remaining of the prayer, then performed two prostrations while sitting.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Bakr ibn Sulayman ibn Abi Hathmah: It reached me that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ bowed two rak'ahs from one of the daytime prayers, either Dhuhr or 'Asr, and concluded with salutation from two rak'ahs. Dhu al-Shimaalayn said to him: 'Has the prayer been shortened, O Messenger of Allah, or have you forgotten?' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: 'The prayer has not been shortened, and I have not forgotten.' Dhu al-Shimaalayn said: 'Some of it did occur, O Messenger of Allah.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ turned to the people and asked: 'Is Dhu al-Yadayn truthful?' They said: 'Yes, O Messenger of Allah.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ then completed the remaining of the prayer and then concluded with salutation. It is also reported from Ibn Shihab from Said ibn al-Musayyab and Abu Salamah ibn Abd al-Rahman with the same meaning. Malik said: Every omission that is a deficit in the prayer should have its prostration before the salutation, and every omission that is an addition to the prayer should have its prostration after the salutation.

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Buhaynnah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ led us in prayer for two rak'ahs, then stood without sitting. The people stood with him. When he completed his prayer and we were waiting for him to conclude, he said the Takbir then performed two prostrations while sitting before the salutation, then he saluted. Also narrated from Yahya ibn Said from Abd al-Rahman ibn Hurmuz from Abdullah ibn Buhaynnah saying: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ prayed the Dhuhr prayer with us, then stood in the two rak'ahs and did not sit. When he completed his prayer, he performed two prostrations, then saluted after that. Malik said regarding one who forgets in his prayer and stands after completing the four, reads and bows: when he raises his head from ruku', if he remembers he had completed, he should return and sit and not prostrate. If he had prostrated one of the two prostrations, I would not see him prostrate the other. Then when he completes his prayer, let him perform two prostrations while sitting after the salutation.

english_translation: Narrated from Malik from Hisham ibn Urahh from his father that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ wore a garment with a pattern, then gave it to Abu Jahm and took from Abu Jahm a Persian garment, saying: 'I looked at its pattern during the prayer.' Also narrated from Malik from Abdullah ibn Abi Bakr that Abu Talhah al-Ansari was praying in his palm grove when a bat flew around, circling in search of an exit. Abu Talhah was pleased with it and followed it with his eyes for a moment, then returned to his prayer. He did not know how much he had prayed. He said: 'This property of mine has caused me trial.' He went to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and mentioned the trial that befell him in his palm grove, saying: 'O Messenger of Allah, it is a charity to Allah, put it wherever you wish.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abdullah ibn Abi Bakr: A man from the Ansar was praying in his palm grove in al-Quff, one of the valleys of Madinah during the season of fruit-bearing, when the palm trees were laden with fruit. He looked at it and was pleased with what he saw of the fruit, then returned to his prayer and realized he did not know how much he had prayed. He said: 'This property of mine has caused me trial.' He came to Uthman ibn Affan while he was Caliph and mentioned this, saying: 'This is charity, so put it in charitable causes.' Uthman ibn Affan sold it for fifty thousand dinars, and that became known as the 'fifty thousand property.'

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever performs the major ghusl on Friday, the ghusl of major ritual impurity, then goes to the mosque in the first hour, it is as if he offered a camel. Whoever goes in the second hour, it is as if he offered a cow. Whoever goes in the third hour, it is as if he offered a horned ram. Whoever goes in the fourth hour, it is as if he offered a hen. Whoever goes in the fifth hour, it is as if he offered an egg. When the Imam comes out, the angels attend to listen to the remembrance.'

english_translation: Narrated by Salim ibn Abdullah: A man from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ entered the mosque on Friday while Umar ibn al-Khattab was delivering the sermon. Umar asked: 'What time is this?' The man replied: 'O Commander of the Believers, I left the market when I heard the call to prayer. I did nothing more than perform ablution.' Umar said: 'Ablution too? Did you not know that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ used to command ghusl?'

english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Umar: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'When one of you comes to Friday, let him perform ghusl.' Malik said: 'Whoever performs ghusl on Friday early in the day, intending it for Friday ghusl, that ghusl does not suffice for him until he performs ghusl when going to the prayer. This is because the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said in Ibn Umar's hadith: "When one of you comes to Friday, let him perform ghusl." Malik also said: 'Whoever performs ghusl on Friday, whether early or late, intending Friday ghusl, and then something nullifies his ablution, he only needs ablution. His ghusl then suffices for him.'
